title: Google Cloud Observability - Monitoring third-party applications
abstract:
# Google Cloud Observability - Monitoring third-party applications
This guide explains how to configure the legacy Cloud Monitoring agent to monitor supported third-party applications. Configuration is only possible when the legacy Monitoring agent is running on Linux. The agent on Windows monitors IIS and MS SQL applications; however, on these systems the agent cannot be configured to collect metrics from other third-party applications.
See [Agent metrics](/monitoring/api/metrics_agent) for a list of the available metrics from the third-party applications. The configuration files are in the Monitoring agent's [GitHub configurationrepository](https://github.com/Stackdriver/stackdriver-agent-service-configs) .
After you have [installed the legacy Monitoringagent](/monitoring/agent/monitoring/installation) , see the following configuration instructions for supported third-party applications:
- [Apache web server](/monitoring/agent/plugins/apache) 
- [JVM Monitoring](/monitoring/agent/plugins/jvm) 
- [Memcached](/monitoring/agent/plugins/memcached) 
- [MySQL](/monitoring/agent/plugins/mysql) 
- [Nginx](/monitoring/agent/plugins/nginx) 
- [Redis](/monitoring/agent/plugins/redis) 
- [StatsD](/monitoring/agent/plugins/statsd) 
The Cloud Monitoring **Metrics Management** page provides information that can help you control the amount you spend on chargeable metrics without affecting observability. The **Metrics Management** page reports the following information:
- Ingestion volumes for both byte- and sample-based billing, across metric  domains and for individual metrics.
- Data about labels and cardinality of metrics.
- Use of metrics in alerting policies and custom dashboards.
- Rate of metric-write errors.
**Metrics Management**
[View and manage metric usage](/monitoring/docs/metrics-management
